intro: Echites havetii, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is characterized by its milky sap, which is a common feature among plants in the Apocynaceae family. Echites havetii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
